examples: And that’s part of the problem, because that’s the behavior of a dilettante.
And whatever else you want to say about decisions that the president has to make, this is not a place for dilettantes to do on-the-job training.
words.defineEn: an amateur who engages in an activity without serious intentions and who pretends to have knowledge
words.defineVi: một người nghiệp dư tham gia vào một hoạt động mà không có ý định nghiêm túc và giả vờ có kiến thức

examples: The construction project was completed without a hitch, thanks to the hard work of our team and the diligence of our contractors.
The writer understands that diligence is the mother of good luck, and that success in writing requires consistent effort, discipline, and hard work.
The student submitted her term paper early, beating her classmates to the punch and impressing her professor with her diligence and quality of work.

But their attorneys insistthat their due diligence surpassed industry standards.
words.defineEn: persistent effort or attention towards a task or goal
words.defineVi: nỗ lực hoặc sự chú ý liên tục đối với một nhiệm vụ hoặc mục tiêu

examples: It’s diligent.

words.defineEn: consistently putting in the necessary time and energy to achieve one's goals
words.defineVi: luôn dành thời gian và năng lượng cần thiết để đạt được mục tiêu của mình

examples: The company is trying to create a young energetic image.

words.defineVi: năng động và tràn đầy năng lượng

examples: It serves always to distract the public councils and enfeeble the public administration.

words.defineEn: showing excessive pride in one's abilities or accomplishments
words.defineVi: thể hiện niềm tự hào quá mức về khả năng hoặc thành tích của một người

examples: No city has escaped the recession, but Seattle has fared best by a long shot.

Britain is still in the grip of recession.
words.defineEn: a period of economic decline marked by a rise in unemployment and the fall in the GDP
words.defineVi: một thời kỳ suy thoái kinh tế được đánh dấu bằng sự gia tăng thất nghiệp và giảm GDP

examples: But men need just one recessive allele and, Doh!

But we’ve also learned that too much similarity can increase our odds of passing along dangerous recessive traits or other developmental problems.
And he came up with recessive and dominant to describe how some traits outweighed others in offspring.
A theory might invoke dominant and recessive genes to explain how brown-haired parents ended up with a red-headed child, or use gravity to shed light on the parabolic trajectory of a baseball.
words.defineEn: (of genes) producing its characteristic phenotype only when its allele is identical
words.defineVi: (của gen) chỉ tạo ra kiểu hình đặc trưng khi alen của nó giống hệt nhau

examples: Dr. Howard never laid a hand on me to assess my pain.

words.defineEn: to form a judgment on the quality, nature, or ability of something or someone

examples: I was the assessor.

examples: First, he promoted people based on merit rather than family position, and second, he brought lower classes of conquered people into his own tribe while dispossessing the leaders of the conquered clans.

words.defineEn: to deprive someone of a property they possess, such as a house, land, or other things of high value

examples: Constricted by an impassable wall of rock-hard ice at the top, and bedrock at the bottom.
